required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lipusu Advanced Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Lung Study Carboplatin in Advanced Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Lung
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open-label, Parallel-group Study of Paclitaxel Liposome Injection and Cisplatin Compared With Gemcitabine and Carboplatin as First-line Therapy in Advanced Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Lung

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the efficacy and the safety of paclitaxel liposome injection and carboplatin compared with gemcitabine and carboplatin as first-line therapy in advanced squamous cell carcinoma of lung.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the efficacy and the safety of paclitaxel liposome injection and carboplatin compared with gemcitabine and carboplatin as first-line therapy in advanced squamous cell carcinoma of lung. This study is the Superiority Trial.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From study entry to measured progressive disease，up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Progression free survival will be calculated from study entry to documented disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study entry to measured progressive disease,up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is the percentage of participants who achieve best overall tumor response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study entry to measured progressive disease,up to 2 years
From study entry to death from any cause,up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) duration is defined from study entry to the date of death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study entry to death from any cause,up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Safety assessment is evaluated by National Cancer Institute(NCI)Common Terminology Criteria for adverse events (CTCAE 4.0).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study entry to measured progressive disease,up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: The quality of life is assessed using the European Organization for the Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC QLQ-C30)

arm_group.description: Liposome paclitaxel(Lipusu®) plus cisplatin. Paclitaxel liposome Sterile injection powder 175 mg/m2, given on day 1 of a 21-day cycle, for 6 cycles. Cisplatin 75 mg/m2, given on day 1 of a 21-day cycle, for 6 cycles.

Gemcitabine (Gemzar®) plus cisplatin. Gemcitabine hydrochloride for injection 1000 mg/m2, given on days 1 and 8 of a 21-day cycle, for 6 cycles. Cisplatin 75 mg/m2, given on day 1 of a 21-day cycle, for 6 cycles.

intervention.description: Paclitaxel liposome injection 175 mg/m2, given on day 1 of a 21-day cycle, for 6 cycles.
Gemcitabine 1000 mg/m2, given on days 1 and 8 of a 21-day cycle, for 6 cycles.
Cisplatin 75 mg/m2, given on day 1 of a 21-day cycle, for 6 cycles.
